2ndexample.cpp

This is an example of how to use the CStconfig class.

#include <stdlib.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <time.h>

#include "../include/C3dMesh.h"

#include <iostream>

const double   pi = 3.14159265358979323846;
const double   degree = pi/180;

double epsA=1e-4;
double epsTrunc=1e-5;

//*********************************************************************
//
int main(int argc, char* argv[])
{
  MConf::C3dMesh mc;
  clock_t tStart = clock();

   mc.load ("w7x-sc1(reduced).bc");
// uncomment one of the following lines in order to read the file from common directory
//  mc.load("X:/w7as/neocl/config/w7x-sc1.bc");        // for Windows
//  mc.load("/afs/ipp/w7as/neocl/config/w7x-sc1.bc");  // for Linux

  if(!mc.isOK()) {std::cout << "Loading error\n";return 1;}
  std::cout << "Loading time=" << double(clock() - tStart)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC <<std::endl;

  mc.truncate(epsTrunc);       // truncate spectrum
  mc.setAccuracy(epsA);        // set accuracy of coordinate transformation
  mc.setB0(2.5,36*degree);     // set value of B on magn. axis at 36degree

  double fiCyl = 1;  // [degree]

  MConf::Vector3d cyl(6,fiCyl*degree,0.5);   // R=6,fi=1deg,Z=0.5
  std::cout<< "cyl=" << cyl <<std::endl;
  if(!mc.cylIsInside(cyl)) {std::cout << "cyl lies outside LCMS\n";return 1;}

//  coordinate transformation
  MConf::Vector3d boozer = mc.cyl2mag(cyl); // boozer is a Vector3d(s,theta,phi)
  std::cout<< "boozer=" << boozer <<std::endl;

  double s = boozer[0];                 // norm. toroidal flux
  double reff = mc.r(s);
  std::cout<< "reff=" << reff <<"[m]"<<std::endl;
  std::cout<< "volume=" << mc.Volume(s) <<std::endl;

// call getBcyl after coordinate transformation
  MConf::Vector3d B = mc.getBcyl();   // B-vector in cylindrical coord.

  std::cout<< "B=" << B <<std::endl<<std::endl;

// Save truncated file in binary format.
//  if(mc.write("w7x-sc1_1e-5.bin8")) cout<< "w7x-sc1_1e-5.bin8 was created\n";
//  if(mc.write("w7x-sc1_1e-5.bin4")) cout<< "w7x-sc1_1e-5.bin8 was created\n";

  return 0;
}
